channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: General Mills CEO Harmening: ‘We don’t sell Cheerios in the morning and then think about sustainability in the afternoon’
item.description: Also: Israel-Iran conflict enters fourth day, Trump orders more mass deportations.

item.title: A record 360,000 students applied for a Goldman Sachs internship this year—and fewer than 1% were accepted
item.description: Being an intern at the investment bank is often a ticket to the upper realms of finance.

item.title: Mamdani and Blake Will Cross-Endorse in N.Y.C. Mayor’s Race
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, a front-runner in the New York City mayor’s race, will announce a second cross-endorsement with Michael Blake, a former state lawmaker...

item.title: With No Clear Off-Ramp, Israel’s War With Iran May Last Weeks, Not Days
item.description: Israel and Iran both have little incentive to stop and no obvious route to outright victory. Much depends on President Trump.

item.title: Slain Minnesota Lawmaker Remembered as Pragmatic Problem Solver
item.description: Colleagues described Representative Melissa Hortman as a skilled, conciliatory lawmaker who was at once steely and warm.

item.title: Gucci owner Kering sees stock jump after Renault CEO quits to lead the luxury group
item.description: Luca de Meo is stepping down from Renault "to take on new challenges outside the automobile sector" after five years at the helm of the company.

item.title: Sahel Crisis Goes Coastal as Insurgents Push Toward the Atlantic
item.description: Insurgents are expanding from West Africa’s Sahel region toward Atlantic coastal nations such as Ivory Coast, creating new terrorism hot spots and dis...

item.title: Economists predict Germany will return to growth this year
item.description: Respondents see gross domestic product in Europe’s largest economy rising 0.2% this year.

item.title: Trump administration offers details of its ‘golden share’ in US Steel deal, but union says it’s ‘disappointed’
item.description: The White House is willing to insert itself aggressively into a private company's affairs even as it has simultaneously pledged to strip away governme...

item.title: Manhunt Ends for Minnesota Suspect, and Israel-Iran Conflict Ramps Up

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Attacked Headquarters of Powerful Iranian Military Unit
item.description: Israel’s military said it had struck the headquarters of the Quds Force, which reports directly to Iran’s supreme leader. The claim could not be immed...

item.title: Iranian Strikes Kill at Least 8 in Israel, Including 4 in Petah Tikva
item.description: Dozens of others were injured overnight across Israel, the authorities said. Israel was striking military sites in Iran and the four-day-old conflict ...

item.title: With No Clear Off-Ramp, Israel’s War With Iran May Last Weeks, Not Days
item.description: Israel and Iran both have little incentive to stop and no obvious route to outright victory. Much depends on President Trump.
